review.title: A Multidimensional Cascade Neuro-Fuzzy System with Neuron Pool Optimization in Each Cascade
review.abstract: A new architecture and learning algorithms for the multidimensional hybrid cascade neural network with neuron pool optimization in each cascade are proposed in this paper. The proposed system differs from the well-known cascade systems in its capability to process multidimensional time series in an online mode, which makes it possible to process non-stationary stochastic and chaotic signals with the required accuracy. Compared to conventional analogs, the proposed system provides computational simplicity and possesses both tracking and filtering capabilities.

metadata.title: A Multidimensional Cascade Neuro-Fuzzy System with Neuron Pool Optimization in Each Cascade

sections.text: Thus, it is not the way in which we have to deal with other approaches arising from their universal approximating abilities and learning capacities. Conventionally, "learning" is defined as the process of adapting synaptic weights, which involves the search for extremism of a given learning criterion. The quality of the learning process can be improved by adapting its synaptic weights. [1, 2] This idea is the basis of evolutionary computational intelligence. [3, 4] One of the most successful implementations of this approach is the high efficiency and simplification of synaptic systems.

This problem can be solved by using undetermined Lagrange multipliers and adaptive multidimensional generalized prediction [30, 31].

metadata.abstractText: A new architecture and learning algorithms for the multidimensional hybrid cascade neural network with neuron pool optimization in each cascade are proposed in this paper. The proposed system differs from the well-known cascade systems in its capability to process multidimensional time series in an online mode, which makes it possible to process non-stationary stochastic and chaotic signals with the required accuracy. Compared to conventional analogs, the proposed system provides computational simplicity and possesses both tracking and filtering capabilities.
